com.informix.jdbc

Interface SQLUDTInput

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.sql.SQLInput
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IfmxUDTSQLInput
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IfxUDTInput

    public interface SQLUDTInput
extends java.sql.SQLInput
    JDBC 2.0

    This SQLUDTInput interface extends from SQLInput. This interface is specificly used for Informix User Defined Types. It contains Informix extension methods for serializing/deserializing fixed length data.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int length()
      Get the total length of the entire data stream.
      byte[] readBytes(int maxlen)
      Read the next attribute in the stream as Java byte array.
      Interval readInterval()
      Read the next attribute in the stream as a Java Interval.
      java.lang.String readString(int maxlen)
      Read the next attribute in the stream as a Java String.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.sql.SQLInput

        readArray, readAsciiStream, readBigDecimal, readBinaryStream, readBlob, readBoolean, readByte, readBytes, readCharacterStream, readClob, readDate, readDouble, readFloat, readInt, readLong, readNClob, readNString, readObject, readRef, readRowId, readShort, readSQLXML, readString, readTime, readTimestamp, readURL, wasNull

    • Method Detail

      • length

        int length()

        Get the total length of the entire data stream.

        Returns:
        the total length.

      • readString

        java.lang.String readString(int maxlen)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException

        Read the next attribute in the stream as a Java String. This method is similar to SQLInput.readString() with the exception that a fixed length of data is read in. This method replaces SQLInput.readString() in the UDT implementation since the user defined type is unknown to the driver, the user MUST supply a length in order for the driver to read in the next attribute properly.

        Parameters:
        maxlen - the maximum size of data to read in.
        Returns:
        the attrubute as String.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • readBytes

        byte[] readBytes(int maxlen)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Read the next attribute in the stream as Java byte array. This method is similar to SQLOutput.readBytes() with the exception that a fixed length of data is read in. This method replaces SQLInput.readBytes() in the UDT implementation since the user defined type is unknown to the driver, the user MUST supply a length in order for the driver to read in the next attribute properly.
        Parameters:
        maxlen - the maximum size of data to read in.
        Returns:
        the attrubute as byte array.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • readInterval

        Interval readInterval()
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Read the next attribute in the stream as a Java Interval. This method is an Informix extension.
        Returns:
        the attrubute as Interval object.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
